data.name: Phil
data.detailed_description:
Imagine, if you will, a sort of dance-off / racing-simulator game crossed with a turret defence, with a splash of world building chucked in there. Sounds awful, right? Luckily, this game is nothing like that.

The game is an indie roguelike-game, produced by one-man game studio Stupid Name Studios.

Play as Phil, an office worker who, on an otherwise unremarkable Thursday afternoon, gets abducted from their place of work to compete on a saddistic intergalactic TV show. Fight your way past a bunch of ridiculous enemies, using a selection of even more ridiclous weapons. Survive to the end, and your name will go down in the annals of history. Or die, and repeat the process again. For ever. And ever.

THE NITTY-GRITTY OF THE GAME

The player will spawn in one of around a dozen levels. Each level will follow a certain style - in the demo level, you are restricted to the London level, fighting against postboxes and coppers. Other planned levels include a Fairground level with clowns and carnies, and a Kitchen level with angry chefs and killer fridges.

Each level will have 3 rounds, with a handful of waves of enemies spawning each round. These rounds will increase in difficulty as the player progresses.

Enemies drop coins on their death, which the player can collect and spend at a number of shops that randomly might spawn on each level. Buy new weapons at The Gun Box, replenish health at The Splend-Vendo, re-fill ammo at The Shell-Out, and last, but very much not least, buy an upgraded version of all weapons at The Upgrade UFO.

You also gain XP whenever you kill an enemy. Once you have gained enough, teleport to the level up room and pick one of three Level-Up Balloons - choose to level up a weapon type, to increase the power of your dash, increase your maximum health, or any of the many other options.
